description: Retrieve the dimensions that can be queried for each specified metric type on a specified DB instance.

parameters.name: ServiceType
parameters.description: The Amazon Web Services service for which Performance Insights returns metrics.

parameters.name: Identifier
parameters.description: An immutable identifier for a data source that is unique within an Amazon Web Services Region. Performance Insights gathers metrics from this data source. To use an Amazon RDS DB instance as a data source, specify its DbiResourceId value. For example, specify db-ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTU1VWZ.

parameters.name: Metrics
parameters.description: The types of metrics for which to retrieve dimensions. Valid values include db.load. (string) --- A generic string type that forbids characters that could expose our service (or services downstream) to security risks around injections.

parameters.name: AuthorizedActions
parameters.description: The actions to discover the dimensions you are authorized to access. If you specify multiple actions, then the response will contain the dimensions common for all the actions. When you don't specify this request parameter or provide an empty list, the response contains all the available dimensions for the target database engine whether or not you are authorized to access them. (string) ---

nested_items.name: MetricDimensions
nested_items.description: The dimension information returned for requested metric types.

nested_items.name: Metric
nested_items.description: The metric type to which the dimension information belongs.

nested_items.name: Groups
nested_items.description: The available dimension groups for a metric type.

nested_items.name: Group
nested_items.description: The name of the dimension group.

nested_items.name: Dimensions
nested_items.description: The dimensions within a dimension group.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the token, up to the value specified by MaxRecords.
